descriptions.content:
In Spoken Tibetan, adjectives typically occur as post-head modifiers. However, when a speaker wishes to place special emphasis or focus on an adjective, the adjective be placed before the head, as in the following examples.

  • དཀར་པོའི་མོ་ཊ་གསར་པ་ག་པར་འདུག “Where is the new white car?”
  • གསར་པའི་མོ་ཊ་དཀར་པོ་ག་པར་འདུག “Where is the new white car?”

In rare cases, more than one adjective may precede the head noun, each marked by genitive case. The order of adjectives in such cases should be the same as when they follow the noun:

  • དཀར་པོའི་གསར་པའི་མོ་ཊ་ “The new white car”
  • *གསར་པའི་དཀར་པོའི་མོ་ཊ་ (Incorrect)

This focalisation function of course is not present in the Literary Tibetan since the pre-nominal position is there a normal position for adjectives. In Literary Tibetan དཀར་པོའི་ཁ་མདོག་ “the white color” is thus equivalent to ཁ་མདོག་དཀར་པོ་.
